```{r}
# Defining variables

# Learning rates
ntrials <- 100

EV <- matrix(0, ncol = 3, nrow = ntrials) %>% data.frame()

x <- rnorm(ntrials, 30, 10)

a <- c(.001, .01, .1)

EV[1,] <- 10

EV$Trials <- 1:ntrials

for (i in 1:length(a)) {
  for (t in 2:ntrials) {
    EV[t, i] <- EV[t - 1, i] + a[i] * (x[t] - EV[t - 1, i])
  }
  colnames(EV)[i] <- paste('LR', a[i], sep = '_')
}


EV %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = 1:ntrials, y = LR_0.1)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  xlab('Trial') +
  theme_minimal()

#plot(EV, type = 'l', xlab = 'trials')

```
